devdoc.details: Phase 4A: Architecture refactored with periphery libraries This contract implements a minimal virtual blockchain with the following features: - Virtual accounts with encrypted balances (euint64) - Virtual transactions with nonce-based replay protection - Virtual block progression with state commitments - Batch transfer processing - EIP-191 signed transfers - Plan 2A secure transfers with FHE secrets - Admin functions for testing and maintenanceArchitecture: - Core functionality for accounts, transfers, and blocks - Uses EVVMSignatureVerifier library for signature operations - Interfaces defined in contracts/interfaces/ for external referenceUsage Flow: 1. Deploy contract with vChainId and evvmID 2. Users register accounts with encrypted initial balances 3. Users perform transfers using encrypted amounts 4. State commitments are calculated off-chain and submitted on-chain 5. Virtual blocks track transaction history

ECDSAInvalidSignatureLength(uint256).details: The signature has an invalid length.

ECDSAInvalidSignatureS(bytes32).details: The signature has an S value that is in the upper half order.

OwnableInvalidOwner(address).details: The owner is not a valid owner account. (eg. `address(0)`)

OwnableUnauthorizedAccount(address).details: The caller account is not authorized to perform an operation.

params.realAddress: The Ethereum address that was registered

params.enabled: Whether FHE secret is now enabled

params.amountAdded: The encrypted amount that was added
params.vaddr: The virtual address that received the balance

params.nonce: The nonce used in this transaction

params.deadline: The deadline that was set for the signature
params.nonce: The nonce used in this transaction
params.signer: The address that signed the transaction

params.newCommitment: The new state commitment (e.g., Merkle root)

params.initialNonce: The initial nonce (always 0 for new accounts)
params.vaddr: The virtual address of the registered account

params.stateCommitment: The state commitment for this block

params.nonce: The nonce used in this transaction
params.vBlockNumber: The virtual block number when the transaction was applied

_applyTransferInternal(bytes32,bytes32,b.details: This public function allows batch processing with try/catchShould only be called internally or via applyTransfer()

params.incrementBlock: If true, increments vBlockNumber (for single transfers). If false, caller handles it (for batches)

returns._0: exists True if the account exists

applySignedTransfer(bytes32,bytes32,byte.details: Requires valid EIP-191 signature from the account owner (registered address)This function provides cryptographic authorization beyond nonce-only protection

params.amount: External encrypted handle of the amount
params.inputProof: ZK proof validating the encrypted input
params.sig: EIP-191 signature from the account owner

applyTransfer(bytes32,bytes32,bytes32,by.details: Transaction model: (from, to, amount, nonce, chainId)For MVP we don't validate signatures, only check nonce and existenceThis function increments the virtual block number automaticallyReverts if:      - Source or destination account doesn't exist      - Nonce doesn't match the account's current nonceEmits VirtualTransferApplied eventUpdates virtual block number and stores transaction

params.amount: External encrypted handle of the amount
params.expectedNonce: Nonce that the caller believes `fromVaddr` has
params.inputProof: ZK proof validating the encrypted input

returns.txId: Transaction ID (unique identifier for this transaction)

applyTransferBatch((bytes32,bytes32,byte.details: All successful transfers are grouped into one virtual block. Failed transfers are skipped.This function uses try/catch to handle individual transfer failures gracefullyIf all transfers fail, the block number increment is revertedReverts if the transfers array is emptyEach successful transfer emits a VirtualTransferApplied event

params.transfers: Array of transfer parameters to process

returns.txIds: Array of transaction IDs for successful transfers (0 for failed ones)

cancelSecureTransfer(bytes32).details: Anyone can cancel expired challenges (cleanup), only owner can cancel valid ones

completeSecureTransfer(bytes32,bytes32,b.details: Only increments nonce after successful secret verificationIf secret is invalid, transfer amount becomes zero (no funds moved)

params.secret: The encrypted secret (must match stored secret)

params._evvmID: EVVM ID for future signature verification

createVirtualBlock(bytes32).details: This function allows explicit block creation with a cryptographic commitmentValidates that the commitment is not empty and that block number increments correctly

params.newCommitment: The state commitment for the new block (e.g., Merkle root of all accounts)

disableAccountSecret(bytes32).details: Only callable by the registered address ownerThe secret is kept in storage (user can re-enable without re-setting)

params.vaddr: The virtual address to disable secret for

enableAccountSecret(bytes32).details: Only callable by the registered address ownerReverts if no secret was ever set

params.vaddr: The virtual address to re-enable secret for

faucetAddBalance(bytes32,bytes32,bytes).details: This function is useful for testing and developmentIt adds encrypted balance to an existing account without affecting the nonce

params.amount: External encrypted handle for the amount to add
params.inputProof: ZK proof validating the encrypted input
params.vaddr: The virtual address of the account to add balance to

generateVaddrFromAddress(address,bytes32.details: This is a helper function to create deterministic vaddr from Ethereum addressesFormula: keccak256(abi.encodePacked(realAddress, vChainId, evvmID, salt))

params.salt: Optional salt for additional entropy (use bytes32(0) for default)

getAccount(bytes32).details: Returns balance (encrypted), nonce, and exists flag

getBlockInfo(uint64).details: Returns block number, state commitment, timestamp, and transaction count

params.blockNumber: The virtual block number to query

returns.blockInfo: The virtual block struct with all block information

getEncryptedBalance(bytes32).details: Frontend uses cofhesdkClient.decryptHandle(...) to see the plaintext value

getTransferMessageHash(bytes32,bytes32,b.details: This hash includes all contextual data to prevent various replay attacks

params.amountCommitment: Commitment to encrypted amount (hash of ciphertext handle)

returns._0: messageHash The hash to be signed by the account owner

getVaddrFromAddress(address).details: Returns bytes32(0) if the address has not been registered via registerAccountFromAddress()

returns._0: vaddr The virtual address associated with the Ethereum address, or bytes32(0) if not registered

getVirtualTransaction(uint256).details: Returns a struct with all transaction details including encrypted amount

returns._0: enabled True if FHE secret is enabled for this account

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

registerAccount(bytes32,bytes32,bytes).details: vaddr can be keccak256(pubkey), hash of real address, or any unique bytes32The account will be initialized with nonce 0 and the provided encrypted balanceFHE permissions are automatically set for the contract and senderReverts if the account already existsEmits VirtualAccountRegistered event

params.initialBalance: External encrypted handle for the initial balance
params.inputProof: ZK proof validating the encrypted input
params.vaddr: Virtual identifier of the account (pseudonym, not linked on-chain to real user)

registerAccountFromAddress(address,bytes.details: Automatically generates vaddr from the Ethereum address using vChainId and evvmIDThis function creates a mapping between the real address and the generated vaddrReverts if the account already exists (either by address or by generated vaddr)Emits AccountRegisteredFromAddress event

params.initialBalance: External encrypted handle for the initial balance
params.inputProof: ZK proof validating the encrypted input

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

requestPay(address,address,bytes32,bytes.details: This function bridges the gap between traditional contracts and the virtual blockchainIt looks up the vaddr for each address and calls applyTransfer()Reverts if either address is not registeredReverts with the same errors as applyTransfer() (bad nonce, account missing, etc.)

params.amount: External encrypted handle of the amount
params.expectedNonce: Nonce that the caller believes the sender's account has
params.from: The Ethereum address of the sender
params.inputProof: ZK proof validating the encrypted input
params.to: The Ethereum address of the recipient

returns.txId: Transaction ID (unique identifier for this transaction)

requestPaySigned(address,address,bytes32.details: This function provides cryptographic authorization for address-based transfersThe signature must be from the `from` address

params.amount: External encrypted handle of the amount
params.from: The Ethereum address of the sender (must sign the transaction)
params.inputProof: ZK proof validating the encrypted input
params.to: The Ethereum address of the recipient

returns.txId: Transaction ID (unique identifier for this transaction)

requestSecureTransfer(bytes32,bytes32,by.details: Verifies signature but does NOT increment nonceUser must call completeSecureTransfer within CHALLENGE_EXPIRY time

returns.challengeId: Unique identifier for completing the transfer

setAccountSecret(bytes32,bytes32,bytes).details: Only callable by the registered address ownerOnce set, transfers can use the challenge-response protocol for extra security

params.inputProof: ZK proof for the encrypted secret
params.secret: The encrypted secret value (user knows plaintext)
params.vaddr: The virtual address to set secret for

setEvvmID(uint256).details: This function allows the contract owner to update the EVVM IDThe EVVM ID is used for signature verification and vaddr generation

params.newEvvmID: The new EVVM ID to set

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

updateStateCommitment(bytes32).details: Useful for updating the commitment when state changes occurValidates that the commitment is not emptyUpdates the current block's commitment if it existsReverts if newCommitment is zeroEmits StateCommitmentUpdated event

params.newCommitment: The new state commitment (must not be bytes32(0))

updateStateCommitmentAfterBatch(bytes32).details: This function should be called after applyTransferBatch() to update the commitmentUseful for maintaining accurate state commitments after batch operations

params.newCommitment: The new state commitment calculated off-chain after the batch

CHALLENGE_EXPIRY.details: User must complete Phase B within this time after Phase A

accountSecrets.details: Only the account owner knows the plaintext value

accounts.details: vaddr is a pseudonymous identifier (e.g. keccak256(pubkey) or hash of real address)

addressToVaddr.details: Enables compatibility layer for traditional contracts

fheSecretEnabled.details: When true, transfers require secret verification via challenge-response

nextTxId.details: Starts at 1, increments for each new transaction

pendingSecureTransfers.details: Phase A creates challenges, Phase B completes them

stateCommitment.details: This can be a Merkle root, hash of all account states, or any state commitment scheme

vaddrToAddress.details: Enables lookup of real address from virtual address

virtualBlocks.details: Stores metadata about each virtual block

virtualTransactions.details: txId is a unique identifier for each transaction

devdoc.title: EVVM Core - Virtual Blockchain with FHE

ZamaProtocolUnsupported().notice: Returned if the Zama protocol is not supported on the current chain

AccountRegisteredFromAddress(address,byt.notice: Emitted when an account is registered from an Ethereum address

AccountSecretUpdated(bytes32,bool).notice: Emitted when account secret is set, updated, or disabled

EvvmIDUpdated(uint256,uint256).notice: Emitted when the EVVM ID is updated

FaucetBalanceAdded(bytes32,bytes32).notice: Emitted when balance is added via faucet

SecureTransferCancelled(bytes32,bytes32,.notice: Emitted when a secure transfer challenge is cancelled or expires

SecureTransferCompleted(bytes32,bytes32,.notice: Emitted when a secure transfer is completed (Phase B)

SecureTransferRequested(bytes32,bytes32,.notice: Emitted when a secure transfer challenge is created (Phase A)

SignedTransferApplied(bytes32,bytes32,ad.notice: Emitted when a signed virtual transaction is applied

StateCommitmentUpdated(bytes32).notice: Emitted when the virtual state commitment is updated

VirtualAccountRegistered(bytes32,uint64).notice: Emitted when a new virtual account is registered

VirtualBlockCreated(uint64,bytes32).notice: Emitted when a virtual block is created

VirtualTransferApplied(bytes32,bytes32,b.notice: Emitted when a virtual transaction is applied

EVVM_DOMAIN().notice: Domain identifier for EVVM signatures (prevents cross-protocol replay)

SIGNATURE_VERSION().notice: Signature scheme version (allows future upgrades without breaking existing signatures)

_applyTransferInternal(bytes32,bytes32,b.notice: Internal function to apply a transfer (used by batch processing)

accountExists(bytes32).notice: Checks if a virtual account exists

addressToVaddr(address).notice: Map of Ethereum addresses to virtual addresses

applySignedTransfer(bytes32,bytes32,byte.notice: Applies a signed transfer within the virtual blockchain

applyTransfer(bytes32,bytes32,bytes32,by.notice: Applies a transfer within the virtual blockchain

applyTransferBatch((bytes32,bytes32,byte.notice: Processes multiple transfers in a single virtual block

cancelSecureTransfer(bytes32).notice: Cancel an expired or unwanted challenge

completeSecureTransfer(bytes32,bytes32,b.notice: Phase B: Complete secure transfer (verifies secret)

createVirtualBlock(bytes32).notice: Creates a new virtual block with a state commitment

disableAccountSecret(bytes32).notice: Disables FHE secret requirement for an account

enableAccountSecret(bytes32).notice: Re-enables a previously set FHE secret

evvmID().notice: EVVM ID for future signature verification

faucetAddBalance(bytes32,bytes32,bytes).notice: Adds balance to a virtual account via faucet (admin only, for testing)

fheSecretEnabled(bytes32).notice: Flag to enable FHE secret requirement per account

generateVaddrFromAddress(address,bytes32.notice: Generates a virtual address from an Ethereum address and optional salt

getAccount(bytes32).notice: Returns the complete virtual account information

getBlockInfo(uint64).notice: Retrieves information about a specific virtual block

getEncryptedBalance(bytes32).notice: Returns the encrypted balance of a virtual account

getNonce(bytes32).notice: Returns the current nonce of a virtual account

getSecureTransferChallenge(bytes32).notice: Get details of a pending secure transfer challenge

getTransferMessageHash(bytes32,bytes32,b.notice: Creates the message hash for a signed transfer operation

getVaddrFromAddress(address).notice: Gets the virtual address for a given Ethereum address

getVirtualTransaction(uint256).notice: Retrieves a virtual transaction by its ID

hasSecretEnabled(bytes32).notice: Checks if an account has FHE secret enabled

nextTxId().notice: Next transaction ID to be assigned

pendingSecureTransfers(bytes32).notice: Map of challenge IDs to pending secure transfers

registerAccount(bytes32,bytes32,bytes).notice: Registers a new account in the virtual blockchain with initial encrypted balance

registerAccountFromAddress(address,bytes.notice: Registers a new account from an Ethereum address (convenience function)

requestPay(address,address,bytes32,bytes.notice: Compatibility function to request payment using Ethereum addresses instead of vaddr

requestPaySigned(address,address,bytes32.notice: Signed version of requestPay - requires EIP-191 signature from sender

requestSecureTransfer(bytes32,bytes32,by.notice: Phase A: Request a secure transfer (creates challenge)

setAccountSecret(bytes32,bytes32,bytes).notice: Sets up an encrypted secret for FHE authentication

stateCommitment().notice: Cryptographic commitment to the current state of the virtual blockchain

updateStateCommitment(bytes32).notice: Updates the state commitment without creating a new block

updateStateCommitmentAfterBatch(bytes32).notice: Updates the state commitment after a batch of transfers

vaddrToAddress(bytes32).notice: Map of virtual addresses to Ethereum addresses (reverse mapping)

virtualBlocks(uint64).notice: Map of block numbers to virtual block information

virtualTransactions(uint256).notice: Map of transaction IDs to virtual transactions

userdoc.notice: MVP of EVVM Core as "virtual blockchain" using FHE for private balancesMigrated from Fhenix CoFHE to Zama FHEVMPhase 2: EIP-191 signature validation addedPhase 2A: Plan 2A challenge-response authentication added
